attributes.action: Keep the cost of holidays down by keeping credit card charges in place
attributes.additional_details: The travel industry is a high volume but the margins that agents make are minimal.  Please help to protect their livelihoods and keep the cost of holidays down for consumers.
attributes.background: In January 2018 UK legislation is changing and travel agents will be charged with the cost of accepting credit & debit cards.  This can be sometimes as much as 2% of the cost of holiday. This will inevitably lead to an increase in holiday prices for consumers.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of the European Union, not the UK Government or Parliament. This legislation was introduced under the Payment services (PSD 2) Directive. You could start a new petition about this issue with the European Parliament, which has its own petitions system: 
 
http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/20150201PVL00037/Petitions 
 
The United Kingdom is leaving the European Union. You could start a new petition asking for the Government to change this policy once the United Kingdom has left the European Union.
